This recently opened restaurant is located in the space formerly occupied by Little Buddah.  The room is now more open and brighter than in the past.   A spicy cabbage salad was delivered to our table while we reviewed the menu.  We started off with shrimp spring rolls that were light and tasty.  For entrees we chose sole filets in a fresh black bean sauce plus the chef's special chili chicken.  

There was an exceptionally long delay between courses so our waitress brought us a second dish of cabbage salad and eventually comped us desserts.  The chicken dish was a crunchy delight though not nearly as spicy as one would believe given the quantity of red chili on the plate.  The sole was tender and equally delicious.  Prices are moderate for a casino restaurant and entrees are generously portioned.

Our individual cheesecakes, though hardly Asian, almost brought one senior to tears. On entering I had secured a grand opening card from the hostess that was good for 25% off menu prices through October 15th.

Very, very slow service.  I ordered general tso chicken and it LOOKED delicious,  but looks were clearly deceiving!  The meat was dark and chewy.  I took 2 bites and the manager saw my face and immediately offered me something else, no questions asked.  I'm so glad I'm just a tourist and can go back home to some good Asian food restaurants.  I would highly recommend you go somewhere else, when in town and at the Palms.

I have been here several times over the past month and each time the food has been consistently awesome and the bartenders Carl and Ray are the best. It is definitely a must visit place for me every time I visit Las Vegas. Very authentic cuisine.

came here on a random weekday with my bf, it is quite the exquisite asian restaurant hidden in the palms hotel. i would've never expected it. we ordered the all you can eat ying yang hot pot (half spicy, half clear broth) and basically went to town. food was fresh, and even though they had forgotten some of the dishes we ordered- the service was attentive and quick. keep in mind the spicy pot is extra spicy! we thoroughly enjoyed and will be back.

They nailed it..5 stars..excellent quick service, outstanding food, top quality ingredients with fantastic meats. Wonderful flavorful sauces. One of the best in the US. One of the nicest restaurants I have ever been to. I am a gourmet foodie. Whatever issues had when they first opened were not apparent tonight. Friendly, very helpful staff.i can not say more good about my experience. Also reasonabe prices. Beautiful presentation of every dish.large portions of food with every dish. This is the only chinese restaurant to go to in vegas for a very upscale experience. I am just as impressed with this restaurant as I was with Uncle Tai's in NYC and Houston. Open to midnight daily

Not too shabby. Got the dry 3 chili chicken which was pretty good and spicy. Tony's chicken wasn't bad. Mongolian beef w bell pepper was good but would have been better with more spice. Roast Beef app was decent but needed more sauce w the cilantro and kinda was fatty. Service was ok.

This place is pretty darn good.  I was impressed.  We had a bunch of friends and colleagues from China and Hong Kong visiting so they wanted to try Hot Pot and it was determined that Lao Sze Chuan was the place to be.  

I was a bit hesitant as this is at the Palms and it is the old Buddha place.  I am thinking I would only take Chinese people to Chinatown.....

Reservations- 5 Star - Reservations are available and this is a plus when the town is busy with conventions. Many of the places in Chinatown is first come, so it can be quite crowded with long waits.

Atmosphere - 4 star- I found the circular design of the restaurant a bit odd, but you know what, it worked. There is plenty of seating for groups of various sizes.

Hot Pot - 4 star - Everything is all you can eat style and you order what you want, you just have to eat it.... Seafood, Vegetables, Meats, it is all available.  Noodles, and everything.  The hotpot has two sides, spicy and regular.  The spicy broth is chock full of red peppers, and you know what, the broth is just right and not too spicy.

The drinks - 4 star - You can pretty much get anything and there is a full bar, so no problems there.  We had plenty and I do like those large Sapporo Beers.

Service - Pretty good - 4 star - We had Adrian and he was really cool and entertaining.  He engaged with our group and we enjoyed his presence. Would have been 5 star but the other people helping us were a just not the same.  Adrian saw 7 of us tight on a table and so he sorted out a table in the back that was rectangular and more suited to chow down on some serious hot pot and all the fixins!

GK Says, check it out!

I'm sad. I really wanted to like the hot pot special here. For $25 it's all you can eat with a great selection of meats, veggies, and even seafood. Our server comes and takes our drink order, we say water and hot tea and he pushes bottled waters, we say no just tap. He looks pissed lol he comes back and we tell him we want the hot pot special and our free appetizer with the Yelp check in. He brings us a menu for the hot pot and tells us to mark what we want. We get the split broth and mark assorted meats and veggies and seafood. He comes back and asks how many orders of the things? We all look at each other confused lol I guess we were supposed to mark it with numbers of orders. We told him how many and sorry we didn't know that's how it goes. He says "well now you know." Lmao rude. The potstickers come and they're good. The rest of the food comes and we asked a different server (ours went missing) if we can have another set of sauces since we're a party of 5 and we wanted a set for the other side of the table. She says no we have to finish the sauces we have first. We ask for tongs for the raw meats and she said no, they don't provide that. So we just ended up using a fork and pushing everything off the plate into the pot. The food was ok. The broths were pretty bland. Sauces were eh. The meats and veggies were pretty good quality. We wanted some rice and our servers were nowhere to be found so it was the manager who got it for us. the service was really lacking, and the food isn't good enough  for us to come back. Some of us regret coming and spending our money here.

Inviting, relaxing space and delicious meal. Yummy dumplings. Wonderful eggplant. Tasty chicken--I believe it was the Tony's Chicken with Three Chili. Service was friendly and attentive, with frequent water refills. I will happily return.

As much as i want to say...this is totally east coast take-out...it isn't. 

well, it is...but it really isn't. 

The chef is touted as a well known chef in china...i can only presume this is true. who am i to argue?

We had a $50 dining credit to apply to the dinner and made resos for three over first days of the new year....so who am i to scoff. 

This was..definitely like and like not. 

I seriously had a few cocktails....we are having dinner with the bf 's pops..and certainly an opportunity and reason to indulge! 

My few dragon cocktails were something very was good. 

We ordered decent, not a hot pot as the other asian dinners around the dining room had, but we selected, dumplings and shrimp apps to start, then chow fun, ribs, and baby bok choy for our mains. The ribs were not pork but were and spicy, yum!!! (triple explanation points on spice), the ribs were lamb perhaps. Did not read the menu as was not in charge of ordering this night.

So, the drinkies...were sooo good. lyche and something dragon cocktail...the noodles were better -- way better, than expected...and the ribs - entree option --- both were....interesting and A-MAY-Z-ING. 

Can we order take-out...pretty please? ((no really, can i? especially for lv, this was...superior))

Dining in the restaurant was certainly nice. If i knew the first time i stayed at The Palms that i had this type of chinese available...pjs and tv, with this food...i would have felt like a queen...well, a queen with above amazing take-out,

Next time i am at The Palms....im not going downstairs...this....shiz-it..is being delivered to my door. 

Really good, not expected - which is such an amazing find.

I heard about this place from friends and decided to stop by. First off the staff were very friendly and attentive. The interior is nicely done and appears very upscale. The prices were very accommodating and I will definitely recommend trying out their all you can eat hot pot. At 23 dollars a person if you are a party of 2 or more this is a great deal for the price. Their hot pot menu also offers a variety of meats, seafood, and vegetables. They have three options for broth. The healthy flavor which is somewhat bland, the house special which is tasty, and another one which I don't remember off the top of my head and haven't tried yet. Good place

Worst dinner ever in Las Vegas! Service was terrible! The chef's special chicken with dry chili was disgusting and definitely dry. Didn't even taste like chicken. I could've been eating moving boxes, ugh! Then I woke up at 3am to explosive diarrhea - painful and gross!! Never again.

i cant' quite remember what we had, but, i do recall it was AMAZING!!!! spicy and full of umami. i think mama had the noodles and i had some kind of beef dish. like i said, AMAZING! what blew us away was when the check came. mind you, we had a round of drinks as well as appetizers and our bill was just under $50! what! very awesome. can't wait to come back.

I normally don't write reviews. But our server at Lao Sze Chuan was horrible. We were doing hot pot that night. The food was okay. My friend recommended me to go there because of the freshness of the meat and seafood for hot pot. But the service was so bad that I would never go back ever. My mom and my boyfriend were so upset. It was all you can eat hot pot. But after the initial order, the server never come by and asked if we needed to order more food. He only had two tables including our table at that time. He spent 10+ minutes talking to the guests sitting at the table right next to us but never bothered to stop by and asked if we needed anything more. After the table next to us left, he was nowhere to be found. We needed to order more food so my boyfriend had to keep looking around for him. Finally he took our order and we asked for more broth for the pot. Of course, 10 minutes later, broth was not added and no food arrived. I understand the food might take a while, but adding broth is so easy. The pot barely had any water left. Finally, the manager saw us just stare at each other and asked if we needed anything. We told him to cancel the order and we wanted the check and leave! The server came by immediately when he saw us talking to the manager. But it was too late, we didn't want to stay anymore. The whole experience was just very frustrating. I don't consider I'm a high maintenance customer. I work in the food industry myself. But the service was really bad. All the guests are equally important. Maybe the guests sitting next to us are high rollers but it doesn't mean that our table should be neglected. Oh, forgot to mention that the tableware was also dirty, so we asked for a new clean bowl but in return, we got another dirty bowl.

I typically do not eat Szechuan food because this cuisine tends to be too spicy and greasy for me; but when I do (because of friends & family), my choice is Lao Sze Chuan.  Welcome to Las Vegas, Chef Tony!  It's good to dine at your restaurants in Chicago and it's great to have you here in Vegas!  My favorite is Tony's chicken with 3 chili!  Love the fact that the prices are GREAT, especially in a casino!

highly over rated. The only thing I enjoyed was the poorly seasoned pot stickers. We ordered the pot stickers, generals tsao chicken, Tonys three spice chicken, and shrimp fried rice. The G.T.C tasted weird. Usually you taste the sauce throughout the whole piece of chicken. This was lightly sauced and the chicken inside tasted like soap. Tonys chicken was that bad until we noticed after we ate a few on top the ones underneath had no sweetness to them, they were just peppery and chewy. The fried rice was very bland with no flavor , Especially the shrimp inside. Im so lost with this place. WE purchased a groupon, and they also demanded a 20% tip charge ... THAT WAS STUPID. It was only 2 of us. Gratuity should only be charged with 5 or more. . YOU WANT SOME REAL CHINESE FOOD?? TAKE YOURSELF TO SAN FRANCISCO.

Terrible for the price.  Bland and oily food. Got Garlic Shrimp, zero garlic taste.  Orange chicken, zero orange. Hot and sour soup, smelled of burnt oil and tasted like sour grease. Seriously, better food at your generic chinese place in the mall.  This place should spend less on decor, and more on learning their craft.  For being located in the Palms, suprisingly bad.  Skip this place at all costs.
We are soooooo glad they decided to bring hot pot back on the menu. They raised it to $2 more but very well worth it!! This is the best place for hot pot in Vegas HANDS DOWN!!

We were at the palms hotel and didn't want to go anywhere (drive) so we thought we'd try the Chinese restaurant in the hotel. It is a little pricey but what would you expect for a restaurant inside a hotel. We had Mongolian lamb and crispy  lemon shrimp (walnut shrimp without the walnuts). The food was very good. We left with our stomachs full.  The only thing is they didn't have the fresh/live fish tank. So no crab or whole fish. But we were satisfied with our menu choices. We would come here again if we come back to the palms

Quite good Chinese food with reasonable prices considering that it's in a Casino (Palms). The decor is wonderful and comfortable. Seafood Fried Rice is excellent. Wonton soup is so-so. General Chow's Chicken was good. Noodle dishes are so-so (my kids love noodles but not here).
Excellent good and service. Waiter was friendly with great recommendations. I recommend for a date night.

We recently dined at Lao Sze Chuan and were very happy with the experience.  I have to say the Szechuan Smoked Tea Duck (with Bone) was fabulous as well as the Sole Fish Fillet with Black Bean Sauce...it was to die for.  There were several of us in our party so we all ordered something different which gave us a chance to sample quite a few entrees.  None of them disappointed.  But the real star of the evening was our server...Rachel...she was spectacular!!!  We will most certainly be here again.

After this meal, I now have an affinity for high quality Chinese food. Started of with their egg rolls and crab Rangoon. Next up was the shrimp, chicken and beef dishes. Topped it off with green tea ice cream. Completely satisfied. Is it worth the trek off the strip? Perhaps if you are heading to Ghost Bar after.

Tried the famous dry chili chicken, garlic cucumbers and don don noodles.  Overall...it was fine...but I was hoping to be blown away.  Ingredients were fine, but the flavor (and I like spicy) were just not exceptional.  Service was friendly but slow.  Next time I will venture into Chinatown.

Have you ever watched MasterChef/Hell's Kitchen and wondered....what is it like being those diners who sit and wait for 1.5+ hrs for their food???

Well, my party and I had THAT experience tonight at Lao Sze Chuan. It was opening night for them, and I guess it was busy and kitchen didn't know how to handle it? We waited almost 2 hours for our food to come to the table. After sitting for 1 hour and 20 mins, we approached the manager to ask about why our food hadn't come, and let them know that we were going to leave. We had made a reservation at 7pm, and at that point, it was 8:25pm, and all we had on our table was water/drinks and the house special spicy cabbage. WE WERE SO HUNGRY!!!

But I will say that management was very professional, and offered to comp us our meal, and invited us to come again. We finally started getting our food close to 9pm, and if you like spicy sze chuan food, it is really quite good. The flavor is there, and the ingredients are of good quality. They just gotta get their kitchen in check. And figure out which tables to bring the food to (yes, at one point, food was brought to our table and then taken away because it was supposed to be for another table! sadness....)

Decor is lovely. Chairs are super comfy.  And definitely order the dry chili chicken :)

If you are looking for "Meh" Chinese take out cuisine, this would probably be a good restaurant. The problem is that this restaurant isn't your local take out, it's a restaurant that will cost two people anywhere from $75-$150 including drinks. 

The food was just plan horrible. No other way to say it. The duck dish I had was cut into extremely small pieces with the bone still on it, but the duck was so dry and old there was no way to remove the bones.

The drinks were horribly sweet with tons of ice and little alcohol. 

The service was impossible. The waitress barely understood a word of English and when I told her the drink was impossible to drink and horrible, her only response was to smile and say "Thank you very much."

Do not waste your money.
